definition: to protect/to defend/to guard against/to prevent
to guard/to defend/to keep watch/to abide by the law/to observe (rules or ritual)/nearby/adjoining

sentences.english: Bayern Munchen is looking for a defensive wing.
sentences.chinese: 拜仁在寻找一个边路防守球员。

sentences.english: Building offside tactics is one kind when use regulation and design defends tactics.
sentences.chinese: 造越位战术是利用规则而设计的一种防守战术。

sentences.english: No problem, I once played a 2-meter-high player successfully.
sentences.chinese: 没问题，我曾经成功的防守一个2米高的球员。

sentences.english: But his defense is the key.
Miami ran plays and the Mavs played defense.
sentences.chinese: 热火打出了配合，而小牛祭出了防守。

sentences.english: You couldn't shuffle or adjust your position once you put your hands up.
sentences.chinese: 一旦你举了手，你就不能再滑步防守和调整位置。

sentences.english: For a low dribble the ball is dribbled on the side of your body opposite the defensive player.
sentences.chinese: 低运球时，球应处于你身体远离防守球员的一侧。

sentences.english: Roxanne And that was against some tough defenders .
sentences.chinese: 萝珊那可是面对对方强悍防守球员的成绩。

sentences.english: And on defense, they definitely did what they had to do.
sentences.chinese: 在防守端，他们也完全做到了他们应该做的。

sentences.english: Defence has always been weak and vulnerable in the basket-ball matches in China.
sentences.chinese: 防守是我国篮球队的一个薄弱环节。

sentences.english: Tight marking or even man marking in midfield can have massive effects on the defensive performance.
sentences.chinese: 中场的紧逼盯人甚至人盯人对防守相当有利。

sentences.english: For this second level it’s a classic base defence of the kind that Men Of War does really well.
sentences.chinese: 第二关是那种战争之人系列很擅长的防守关卡。

sentences.english: The coach staggered his players in the back field.
sentences.chinese: 这位教练在后场摆了个锯齿形防守阵式。

sentences.english: Organised the defence, and scored Italy’s equaliser.
sentences.chinese: 组织起了本方的防守，并且打进了扳平比分的一球。

sentences.english: In the defence I appreciate so much Zapata, if they sign him is a great deal.
sentences.chinese: 防守我比较欣赏萨帕塔，如果签下他那将是比好交易。
然后人盯人的防守开始了。

definition: to attack/to assault/to go on the offensive/attack/assault/offense (sports)
to receive a served ball (volleyball, tennis etc)/to catch a ball thrown by sb
